description.narrative:
Reduction in GHG emissions: The proposed investment is expected to generate significant environmental and economic benefits through the development of solar projects. The investment is expected to reduce around ~80,069 tCO2 of GHG emissions per annum.
Support eco-system for development of solar energy projects and job creation: Besides the direct impact of reduction of GHG emissions, the investment would have a cascading effect on vendors and services providers to solar energy projects that would be supported through the investment. This would lead to expansion of the eco-system for such projects and assist job creation.
Demonstration Effect: IFC's support to LTIF will further strengthen the latter's commitment to the renewable energy sector, which is likely to attract other local and international financial institutions to increase their investments in LTIF and LTFH group.

table, .k-table{ border-collapse:collapse; width:100%; table-layout:fixed; margin-bottom: 15px;} .k-table, .k-table td, table, table td {outline: 0;border: 1px solid #000; } .k-table td, table td { padding: 5px; } The proposed project involves the subscription by IFC to Non-Convertible Debentures issued by L&T Infrastructure Finance Limited (LTIF or the Company) for the purpose of financing solar energy projects in India. Established in 2006, LTIF is an established Non-Banking Finance Company classified as Infrastructure Finance Company (IFC) by Reserve Bank of India, focused on financing of infrastructure projects, covering various sectors. LTIF offers a one-stop solution for all infrastructure financing including term loans, quasi equity/debenture subscriptions, non-fund based support, co-promoting projects etc. The proposed investment is consistent with the World Bank Groups India Country Partnership Strategy as it aligns with the engagement areas of (i) Inclusion by improving access to electricity (ii) Transformation by reducing Greenhouse Gas (GHG) emissions through energy efficiency and renewable energy.
